 19
 20/// Enum to indicate that an Applied_layout or Rt_layout object
 21/// will not be used and therefor should not be initialized when
 22/// constructed.
 23enum empty_layout_type { empty_layout };
 24
 25/// Class to represent either a interleaved-pointer or a split-pointer.
 26///
 27/// Primary definition handles non-complex types.  Functions
 28/// corresponding to split-pointer cause a runtime error, since
 29/// "split" does not make sense for non-complex types.
 30template <typename T>
 31class Rt_pointer
 32{
 33  // Constructors
 34public:
 35  // Default constructor creates a NULL pointer.
 36  Rt_pointer() : ptr_(0) {}
 37
 38  // Some places unfortunately require a Rt_pointer const_cast
 39  // (FFT workspaces, notably).
 40  // Rt_pointer(T* ptr) : ptr_(ptr) {}
 41  Rt_pointer(T const *ptr) : ptr_(const_cast<T*>(ptr)) {}
 42  Rt_pointer(std::pair<T*, T*> const&) { assert(0);}
 43
 44  // Accessors.
 45  T*               as_real() const { return ptr_;}
 46  T*               as_inter() const { return ptr_;}
 47  std::pair<T*,T*> as_split() const { assert(0); return std::pair<T*,T*>(0,0);}
 48
 49  bool is_null() const { return ptr_ == 0;}
 50
 51private:
 52  T* ptr_;
 53};
 54
 55/// Specialization for complex types.  Whether a Rt_pointer refers to a
 56/// interleaved or split pointer is determined by the using code.
 57/// (However, when initializing an interleaved pointer, `ptr1_` is set
 58/// to 0).
 59template <typename T>
 60class Rt_pointer<complex<T> >
 61{
 62public:
 63  // Default constructor creates a NULL pointer.
 64  Rt_pointer() : ptr0_(0), ptr1_(0) {}
 65  // Some places unfortunately require a Rt_pointer const_cast
 66  // (FFT workspaces, notably).
 67  // Rt_pointer(complex<T>* ptr) : ptr0_(reinterpret_cast<T*>(ptr)), ptr1_(0) {}
 68  Rt_pointer(complex<T> const *ptr)
 69    : ptr0_(reinterpret_cast<T*>(const_cast<complex<T> *>(ptr))), ptr1_(0) {}
 70  Rt_pointer(std::pair<T*, T*> const& ptr) : ptr0_(ptr.first), ptr1_(ptr.second) {}
 71  Rt_pointer(std::pair<T const*, T const*> const& ptr)
 72    : ptr0_(const_cast<T*>(ptr.first)), ptr1_(const_cast<T*>(ptr.second)) {}
 73
 74  T*               as_real() const { assert(0); return 0; }
 75  complex<T>*       as_inter() const { return reinterpret_cast<complex<T>*>(ptr0_); }
 76  std::pair<T*, T*> as_split() const { return std::pair<T*,T*>(ptr0_, ptr1_); }
 77
 78  bool is_null() const { return ptr0_ == 0; }
 79
 80private:
 81  T* ptr0_;
 82  T* ptr1_;
 83};
 84
 85template <typename T>
 86class const_Rt_pointer
 87{
 88public:
 89  const_Rt_pointer() : ptr_(0) {}
 90
 91  const_Rt_pointer(T const *ptr) : ptr_(ptr) {}
 92  const_Rt_pointer(std::pair<T const *, T const *> const&) { assert(0);}
 93  const_Rt_pointer(std::pair<T *, T *> const&) { assert(0);}
 94  const_Rt_pointer(Rt_pointer<T> const &r) : ptr_(r.as_real()) {}
 95
 96  // Accessors.
 97  T const *as_real() const { return ptr_;}
 98  T const *as_inter() const { return ptr_;}
 99  std::pair<T const *,T const *> as_split() const 
100  { assert(0); return std::pair<T const *,T const *>(0,0);}
101
102  bool is_null() const { return ptr_ == 0;}
103
104private:
105  T const *ptr_;
106};
107
108template <typename T>
109class const_Rt_pointer<complex<T> >
110{
111public:
112  // Default constructor creates a NULL pointer.
113  const_Rt_pointer() : ptr0_(0), ptr1_(0) {}
114  const_Rt_pointer(complex<T> const *ptr) : ptr0_(reinterpret_cast<T const*>(ptr)), ptr1_(0) {}
115  const_Rt_pointer(std::pair<T const *, T const *> const &ptr)
116    : ptr0_(ptr.first), ptr1_(ptr.second) {}
117  const_Rt_pointer(std::pair<T *, T *> const &ptr)
118    : ptr0_(ptr.first), ptr1_(ptr.second) {}
119  const_Rt_pointer(Rt_pointer<complex<T> > const &ptr)
120  {
121    std::pair<T*,T*> tmp = ptr.as_split();
122    ptr0_ = tmp.first;
123    ptr1_ = tmp.second;
124  }
125
126  T const *as_real() const { assert(0); return 0;}
127  complex<T> const *as_inter() const
128  { return reinterpret_cast<complex<T> const *>(ptr0_);}
129  std::pair<T const *, T const *> as_split() const 
130  { return std::pair<T const *,T const *>(ptr0_, ptr1_);}
131
132  bool is_null() const { return ptr0_ == 0;}
133
134private:
135  T const *ptr0_;
136  T const *ptr1_;
137};
138
139/// Runtime dimension-order (corresponds to compile-time tuples).
140///
141/// Member names are chosen to correspond to tuple's.
142///
143class Rt_tuple
144{
145public:
146  Rt_tuple() : impl_dim0(0), impl_dim1(1), impl_dim2(2) {}
147  Rt_tuple(dimension_type d0, dimension_type d1, dimension_type d2)
148    : impl_dim0(d0), impl_dim1(d1), impl_dim2(d2)
149  {}
150
151  // Convenience constructor from a compile-time tuple.
152  template <dimension_type D0,
153	    dimension_type D1,
154	    dimension_type D2>
155  Rt_tuple(tuple<D0, D1, D2>)
156    : impl_dim0(D0), impl_dim1(D1), impl_dim2(D2)
157  {}
158
159  dimension_type impl_dim0;
160  dimension_type impl_dim1;
161  dimension_type impl_dim2;
162};
163
164
165
166struct Any_type;
167
168
169/// Stride_unknown indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
170/// stride is unknown.
171struct Stride_unknown
172{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = false; };
173
174/// Stride_unit indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension is
175/// known to be unit-stride.
176struct Stride_unit
177{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
178
179/// Stride_unit_dense indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
180/// is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to be
181/// dense (contiguous).
182struct Stride_unit_dense
183{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
184
185/// Stride_unit_align indicates that at compile-time, minor dimension
186/// is known to be unit-stride and major dimensions are known to
187/// start on aligned boundaries.
188template <unsigned Align> struct Stride_unit_align
189{ static bool const is_ct_unit_stride = true; };
190
191/// is_unit_stride indicates whether at compile-time, minor dimension is
192/// known to be unit-stride.
193template <typename P>
194struct is_unit_stride { static bool const value = false;};
195template <>
196struct is_unit_stride<Stride_unit> { static bool const value = true;};
197template <>
198struct is_unit_stride<Stride_unit_dense> { static bool const value = true;};
199template <unsigned A>
200struct is_unit_stride<Stride_unit_align<A> > { static bool const value = true;};
201
202/// Runtime packing format enum.
203enum rt_pack_type
204{
205  stride_unknown,
206  stride_unit,
207  stride_unit_dense,
208  stride_unit_align
209};
210
211template <typename PackFmt>
212struct Is_stride_unit_align
213{
214  static bool     const value = false;
215  static unsigned const align = 0;
216};
217
218template <unsigned Align>
219struct Is_stride_unit_align<Stride_unit_align<Align> >
220{
221  static bool     const value = true;
222  static unsigned const align = Align;
223};
224
225
226
227/// Cmplx_inter_fmt indicates that complex data is stored as an
228/// array of type complex, which is assumed to be interleaved.
229struct Cmplx_inter_fmt {};
230/// Cmplx_split_fmt indicates that complex data is stored in
231/// separate arrays of real and imaginary data.
232struct Cmplx_split_fmt {};
233
234/// Runtime complex format enum.
235enum rt_complex_type
236{
237  cmplx_split_fmt,
238  cmplx_inter_fmt
239};
240
241/// Validity check for packing format tags.
242template <typename T>
243struct Valid_pack_type;
244
245template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Any_type> {};
246template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit> {};
247template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_dense> {};
248template <> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unknown> {};
249template <unsigned Align> struct Valid_pack_type<Stride_unit_align<Align> > {};
250
251/// Validity check for complex format tags.
252template <typename T>
253struct Valid_complex_fmt;
254
255template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Any_type> {};
256template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_inter_fmt> {};
257template <> struct Valid_complex_fmt<Cmplx_split_fmt> {};
258
259/// Validity check for dimension-ordering tuples.
260template <typename T>
261struct Valid_order;
262
263template <> struct Valid_order<Any_type> {};
264template <dimension_type Dim0,
265	  dimension_type Dim1,
266	  dimension_type Dim2>
267struct Valid_order<tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> > {};
268
269/// Layout tuple groups a block's (compile-time) data layout information.
270///
271/// Template parameters:
272///   :D: The block's dimension.
273///   :Order: The dimension ordering (`tuple<0, 1, 2>`, `row2_type`, etc.)
274///   :PackType: One of `Stride_unit`, `Stride_unit_dense`,
275///              `Stride_unit_align` <...>, `Stride_unknown`.
276///   :ComplexType: Either `Cmplx_inter_fmt` or `Cmplx_split_fmt`
277template <dimension_type D,
278	  typename       Order,
279	  typename       PackType,
280	  typename	 ComplexType = Cmplx_inter_fmt>
281struct Layout : Valid_pack_type<PackType>,
282                Valid_order<Order>
283#if !(defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ < 4)
284  // G++ 3.4.4 enters an infinite loop processing this compile-time
285  // assertion (060505).  G++ 4.1 is OK.
286  , Valid_complex_fmt<ComplexType>
287#endif
288{
289  static dimension_type const dim = D;
290  typedef PackType    pack_type;
291  typedef Order       order_type;
292  typedef ComplexType complex_type;
293};
294
295/// Runtime layout class encapsulating:
296///
297///  - Dimension
298///  - Dimension ordering
299///  - Packing format
300///  - Complex format
301template <dimension_type Dim>
302struct Rt_layout
303{
304  // Dimension is fixed at compile-time.
305  static dimension_type const dim = Dim;
306
307  // Run-time layout.
308  rt_pack_type      pack;
309  Rt_tuple          order;
310  rt_complex_type   complex;
311  unsigned          align;	// Only valid if pack == stride_unit_align
312
313  // Construct an empty Rt_layout object.
314  Rt_layout() {}
315
316  Rt_layout(rt_pack_type    a_pack,
317	    Rt_tuple const& a_order,
318	    rt_complex_type a_complex,
319	    unsigned        a_align)
320    : pack    (a_pack),
321      order   (a_order),
322      complex (a_complex),
323      align   (a_align)
324  {}
325};
326
327template <dimension_type D>
328bool operator==(Rt_layout<D> const &l1, Rt_layout<D> const &l2)
329{
330  return (l1.pack == l2.pack &&
331	  l1.order == l2.order &&
332	  l1.complex == l2.complex &&
333	  (l1.pack != stride_unit_align || (l1.align == l2.align)));
334}
335
336/// Applied_layout takes the layout policies encapsulated by a
337/// Layout and applys them to map multi-dimensional indices into
338/// memory offsets.
339template <typename LP>
340struct Applied_layout;
341
342template <typename Order, typename ComplexLayout>
343class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
344{
345public:
346  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
347  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>  order_type;
348  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
349  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
350
351  Applied_layout(length_type size) : size_(size) {}
352  template <typename ExtentT>
353  Applied_layout(ExtentT const &extent) : size_(size_of_dim(extent, 0)) {}
354
355  index_type index(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i;}
356  index_type index(Index<1> const &i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i[0];}
357  stride_type stride(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return 1;}
358  length_type size(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
359  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
360
361private:
362  length_type size_;
363};
364
365template <unsigned Align, typename Order, typename ComplexLayout>
366class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unit_align<Align>, ComplexLayout> >
367{
368public:
369  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
370  typedef Order           order_type;
371  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
372  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
373
374  Applied_layout(length_type size) : size_(size) {}
375  template <typename ExtentT>
376  Applied_layout(ExtentT const &extent) : size_(size_of_dim(extent, 0)) {}
377
378  index_type index(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i;}
379  index_type index(Index<1> const &i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i[0];}
380  stride_type stride(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return 1;}
381  length_type size(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
382  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
383
384private:
385  length_type size_;
386};
387
388template <typename Order, typename ComplexLayout>
389class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unit, ComplexLayout> >
390{
391public:
392  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
393  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>  order_type;
394  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
395  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
396
397  Applied_layout(length_type size) : size_(size) {}
398  template <typename ExtentT>
399  Applied_layout(ExtentT const &extent) : size_(size_of_dim(extent, 0)) {}
400
401  index_type index(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i;}
402  index_type index(Index<1> const &i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i[0];}
403  stride_type stride(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return 1;}
404  length_type size(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
405  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
406
407private:
408  length_type size_;
409};
410
411template <typename Order, typename ComplexLayout>
412class Applied_layout<Layout<1, Order, Stride_unknown, ComplexLayout> >
413{
414public:
415  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
416  typedef Order  order_type;
417  typedef Stride_unknown pack_type;
418  typedef ComplexLayout complex_type;
419
420  Applied_layout(length_type size, stride_type stride = 1)
421    : size_(size), stride_(stride) {}
422
423  template <typename ExtentT>
424  Applied_layout(ExtentT const &extent)
425    : size_(size_of_dim(extent, 0)), stride_(1) {}
426
427  index_type index(index_type i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i * stride_;}
428  index_type index(Index<1> const &i) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return i[0] * stride_;}
429  stride_type stride(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return stride_;}
430  length_type size(dimension_type) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
431  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_;}
432
433private:
434  length_type size_;
435  stride_type stride_;
436};
437
438template <typename ComplexLayout>
439class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<0, 1, 2>, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
440{
441public:
442  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
443  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>  order_type;
444  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
445  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
446
447  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
448  {
449    size_[0] = size0;
450    size_[1] = size1;
451  }
452
453  template <typename ExtentT>
454  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
455  {
456    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
457    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
458  }
459
460  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1)
461    const VSIP_NOTHROW
462  {
463    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
464    return idx0 * size_[1] + idx1;
465  }
466
467  index_type index(Index<2> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
468  { return idx[0] * size_[1] + idx[1];}
469
470  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
471  { return d == 0 ? size_[1] : 1;}
472
473  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
474  { return size_[d];}
475
476  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
477  { return size_[1] * size_[0];}
478
479private:
480  length_type size_[2];
481};
482
483template <typename ComplexLayout>
484class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<1, 0, 2>, Stride_unit_dense, ComplexLayout> >
485{
486public:
487  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
488  typedef tuple<1, 0, 2>  order_type;
489  typedef Stride_unit_dense pack_type;
490  typedef ComplexLayout   complex_type;
491
492  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
493  {
494    size_[0] = size0;
495    size_[1] = size1;
496  }
497
498  template <typename ExtentT>
499  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
500  {
501    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
502    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
503  }
504
505  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1) const VSIP_NOTHROW
506  {
507    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
508    return idx0 + idx1 * size_[0];
509  }
510
511  index_type index(Index<2> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
512  { return idx[0] + idx[1] * size_[0];}
513
514  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
515  { return d == 0 ? 1 : size_[0];}
516
517  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
518  { return size_[d];}
519
520  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
521  { return size_[1] * size_[0];}
522
523private:
524  length_type size_[2];
525};
526
527
528
529template <unsigned Align, typename ComplexLayout>
530class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<0, 1, 2>, Stride_unit_align<Align>,
531			   ComplexLayout> >
532{
533public:
534  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
535  typedef tuple<0, 1, 2>         order_type;
536  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
537  typedef ComplexLayout          complex_type;
538
539  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
540  {
541    size_[0] = size0;
542    size_[1] = size1;
543
544    stride_ = size_[1];
545
546    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
547      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
548  }
549
550  template <typename ExtentT>
551  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
552  {
553    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
554    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
555
556    stride_ = size_[1];
557
558    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
559      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
560  }
561
562  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1) const VSIP_NOTHROW
563  {
564    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
565    return idx0 * stride_ + idx1;
566  }
567
568  index_type index(Index<2> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
569  { return idx[0] * stride_ + idx[1];}
570
571  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
572  { return d == 0 ? stride_ : 1;}
573
574  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
575  { return size_[d];}
576
577  length_type total_size() const
578  { return stride_ * size_[0] - (stride_-size_[1]);}
579
580private:
581  length_type size_[2];
582  length_type stride_;
583};
584
585
586
587template <unsigned Align, typename ComplexLayout>
588class Applied_layout<Layout<2, tuple<1, 0, 2>, Stride_unit_align<Align>,
589			   ComplexLayout> >
590{
591public:
592  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
593  typedef tuple<1, 0, 2>           order_type;
594  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
595  typedef ComplexLayout            complex_type;
596
597  Applied_layout(length_type size0, length_type size1)
598  {
599    size_[0] = size0;
600    size_[1] = size1;
601
602    stride_ = size_[1];
603
604    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
605      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
606  }
607
608  template <typename ExtentT>
609  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
610  {
611    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
612    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
613
614    stride_ = size_[0];
615
616    if (stride_ % Align != 0)
617      stride_ += (Align - stride_%Align);
618  }
619
620  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1) const VSIP_NOTHROW
621  {
622    assert(idx0 < size_[0] && idx1 < size_[1]);
623    return idx0 + idx1 * stride_;
624  }
625
626  index_type index(Index<2> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
627  { return idx[0] + idx[1] * stride_;}
628
629  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
630  { return d == 1 ? stride_ : 1;}
631
632  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
633  { return size_[d];}
634
635  length_type total_size() const
636  { return stride_ * size_[1] - (stride_-size_[0]);}
637
638private:
639  length_type size_[2];
640  length_type stride_;
641};
642
643template <typename Order, typename ComplexLayout>
644class Applied_layout<Layout<2, Order, Stride_unknown, ComplexLayout> >
645{
646public:
647  static dimension_type const dim = 2;
648  typedef Order  order_type;
649  typedef Stride_unknown pack_type;
650  typedef ComplexLayout complex_type;
651
652  Applied_layout(length_type size0, stride_type stride0,
653		 length_type size1, stride_type stride1)
654  {
655    size_[0] = size0;
656    size_[1] = size1;
657    stride_[0] = stride0;
658    stride_[1] = stride1;
659  }
660
661  // template <typename ExtentT>
662  // Applied_layout(ExtentT const &extent)
663  // {
664  //   size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
665  //   size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
666  //   stride_[0] = stride0; // XX
667  //   stride_[1] = stride1; // XX
668  // }
669
670  index_type index(index_type i, index_type j) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
671  { return i * stride_[0] + j * stride_[1];}
672  index_type index(Index<2> const &i) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
673  { return i[0] * stride_[0] + i[1] * stride_[1];}
674  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
675  { return stride_[d];}
676  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW 
677  { return size_[d];}
678  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
679  { return size_[0] * size_[1];}
680
681private:
682  length_type size_[dim];
683  stride_type stride_[dim];
684};
685
686template <dimension_type Dim0,
687	  dimension_type Dim1,
688	  dimension_type Dim2,
689	  typename       ComplexLayout>
690class Applied_layout<Layout<3, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>, Stride_unit_dense,
691			   ComplexLayout> >
692{
693public:
694  static dimension_type const dim = 3;
695  typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2> order_type;
696  typedef Stride_unit_dense         pack_type;
697  typedef ComplexLayout           complex_type;
698
699  template <typename ExtentT>
700  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
701  {
702    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
703    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
704    size_[2] = size_of_dim(extent, 2);
705  }
706
707  index_type index(Index<3> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
708  {
709    assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
710    return idx[Dim0]*size_[Dim1]*size_[Dim2] +
711           idx[Dim1]*size_[Dim2] + 
712           idx[Dim2];
713  }
714
715  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2)
716    const VSIP_NOTHROW
717  { return index(Index<3>(idx0, idx1, idx2));}
718
719  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
720  {
721    return d == Dim2 ? 1 :
722           d == Dim1 ? size_[Dim2]
723                     : size_[Dim1] * size_[Dim2];
724
725  }
726
727  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
728  { return size_[d];}
729
730  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
731  { return size_[2] * size_[1] * size_[0];}
732
733private:
734  length_type size_[3];
735};
736
737
738
739template <dimension_type Dim0,
740	  dimension_type Dim1,
741	  dimension_type Dim2,
742	  unsigned       Align,
743	  typename       ComplexLayout>
744class Applied_layout<Layout<3, tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>,
745			    Stride_unit_align<Align>,
746			    ComplexLayout> >
747{
748public:
749  static dimension_type const dim = 3;
750  typedef tuple<Dim0, Dim1, Dim2>  order_type;
751  typedef Stride_unit_align<Align> pack_type;
752  typedef ComplexLayout            complex_type;
753
754  template <typename ExtentT>
755  Applied_layout(ExtentT const& extent)
756  {
757    size_[0] = size_of_dim(extent, 0);
758    size_[1] = size_of_dim(extent, 1);
759    size_[2] = size_of_dim(extent, 2);
760
761    stride_[Dim2] = 1;
762    stride_[Dim1] = size_[Dim2];
763    if (stride_[Dim1] % Align != 0)
764      stride_[Dim1] += (Align - stride_[Dim1]%Align);
765    stride_[Dim0] = size_[Dim1] * stride_[Dim1];
766  }
767
768  index_type index(Index<3> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
769  {
770    assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
771    return idx[Dim0]*stride_[Dim0] +
772           idx[Dim1]*stride_[Dim1] + 
773           idx[Dim2];
774  }
775
776  index_type index(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2)
777    const VSIP_NOTHROW
778  { return index(Index<3>(idx0, idx1, idx2));}
779
780  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
781  { return stride_[d];}
782
783  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
784  { return size_[d];}
785
786  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
787  { return size_[Dim0] * stride_[Dim0];}
788
789private:
790  length_type size_  [3];
791  stride_type stride_[3];
792};
793
794/// Applied run-time layout.
795/// This object gets created for run-time extdata access.
796/// Efficiency is important to reduce library interface overhead.
797/// Don't store the whole Rt_layout, only the parts we need:
798/// the complex_format and part of the dimension-order.
799template <dimension_type D>
800class Applied_layout<Rt_layout<D> >
801{
802public:
803  static dimension_type const dim = D;
804
805  // Construct an empty Applied_layout.  Used when it is known that object
806  // will not be used.
807  Applied_layout(empty_layout_type)
808  {
809    for (dimension_type d = 0; d < D; ++d)
810    {
811      order_[d] = 0;
812      size_[d] = 0;
813      stride_[d] = 1;
814    }
815  }
816
817  /// Construct Applied_layout object.
818  ///
819  /// Template parameters:
820  ///
821  ///   :ExtentT: a type capable of encoding an extent (Length or Domain)
822  ///
823  /// Arguments:
824  ///
825  ///   :layout:    the run-time layout.
826  ///   :extent:    the extent of the data to layout.
827  ///   :elem_size: the size of a data element (in bytes).
828  template <typename ExtentT>
829  Applied_layout(Rt_layout<D> const& layout,
830		 ExtentT const &extent,
831		 length_type elem_size = 1)
832    : cformat_(layout.complex)
833  {
834    assert(layout.pack != stride_unit_align || 
835           layout.align == 0 || layout.align % elem_size == 0);
836
837    for (dimension_type d=0; d<D; ++d)
838      size_[d] = size_of_dim(extent, d);
839
840    if (D == 3)
841    {
842      order_[2] = layout.order.impl_dim2;
843      order_[1] = layout.order.impl_dim1;
844      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
845
846      stride_[order_[2]] = 1;
847      stride_[order_[1]] = size_[order_[2]];
848      if (layout.pack == stride_unit_align && 
849	  layout.align != 0 &&
850	  (elem_size*stride_[order_[1]]) % layout.align != 0)
851      {
852	stride_type adjust =
853	  layout.align - (stride_[order_[1]] * elem_size)%layout.align;
854	assert(adjust > 0 && adjust % elem_size == 0);
855	adjust /= elem_size;
856	stride_[order_[1]] += adjust;
857	assert((stride_[order_[1]] * elem_size)%layout.align == 0);
858      }
859      stride_[order_[0]] = size_[order_[1]] * stride_[order_[1]];
860    }
861    else if (D == 2)
862    {
863      // Copy only the portion of the dimension-order that we use.
864      order_[1] = layout.order.impl_dim1;
865      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
866
867      stride_[order_[1]] = 1;
868      stride_[order_[0]] = size_[order_[1]];
869
870      if (layout.pack == stride_unit_align && 
871	  layout.align != 0 &&
872	  (elem_size*stride_[order_[0]]) % layout.align != 0)
873      {
874	stride_type adjust =
875	  layout.align - (stride_[order_[0]] * elem_size)%layout.align;
876	assert(adjust > 0 && adjust % elem_size == 0);
877	adjust /= elem_size;
878	stride_[order_[0]] += adjust;
879	assert((stride_[order_[0]] * elem_size)%layout.align == 0);
880      }
881    }
882    else  // (D == 1)
883    {
884      // Copy only the portion of the dimension-order that we use.
885      order_[0] = layout.order.impl_dim0;
886
887      stride_[0] = 1;
888    }
889  }
890
891  index_type index(Index<D> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
892  {
893    if (D == 3)
894    {
895      assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1] && idx[2] < size_[2]);
896      return idx[order_[0]]*stride_[order_[0]] +
897	     idx[order_[1]]*stride_[order_[1]] + 
898	     idx[order_[2]];
899    }
900    else if (D == 2)
901    {
902      assert(idx[0] < size_[0] && idx[1] < size_[1]);
903      return idx[order_[0]]*stride_[order_[0]] +
904	     idx[order_[1]];
905    }
906    else // (D == 1)
907    {
908      assert(idx[0] < size_[0]);
909      return idx[0];
910    }
911  }
912  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return stride_[d];}
913  length_type size(dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW { return size_[d];}
914
915  length_type total_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
916  { return size_[order_[0]] * stride_[order_[0]];}
917  rt_complex_type complex_format() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return cformat_;}
918
919private:
920  rt_complex_type cformat_;
921  dimension_type order_ [D];
922  length_type    size_  [D];
923  stride_type    stride_[D];
924};
925
926} // namespace vsip::impl
927} // namespace vsip
928
929#endif

synopsis (version 0.12)
